Human Activity Recognition / HCI



The projects were related to recognize human activities from mobile devices, such as wearable devices and mobile phones, in Mobile Healthcare/HCI lab and IoT startup.


Table of Contents

  • 1. Activity Recognition with Wearable Devices
  • 2. Sleep Respiration Monitoring
  • 3. Human Proximity Recognition
  • 4. 3D Virtual Mobile Interface



1. Activity Recognition with Wearable Devices


Description

The goal of this project was to develop fully automated table tennis scoring system based on smartwatches and mobile phones. Smartwatches were used to recognize swing gestures and classify their swing types. Mobile phones were used to recognize which place a ball is dropped.

My role was to develop human activity recognition and design the software arcthitecture of the project. Swing data were collected from Android smartwatch and swing gestures were classified into 3 type: forehand, backhand and no swing. Accelerometer and gravity sensors were used to classify swing types, and the noise data were filtered with filtering algorithms. The software architecture was designed to integrate gesture recognition, sound detection with FFT and Wifi-Direct technology.

To see details, please refer to the paper in 'Related Articles' below.


Skills

Java
FFT
Android
Android Wearable

2. Sleep Respiration Monitoring


Description

The goal of this project was to track human respiration rate on sleeping.

My role was to develop a server to collect respiration data on sleep and visualize the status in real time. The stress test was performed to measure how much one server could sustain a bunch of data sent every 500ms.

To see details, please refer to the paper in 'Related Articles' below.



Skills

Python
HTML, CSS, Javascript
Chart.js
Django


Period

  • 1 Mar

    2020

Related Articles

  • [Paper] IEEE Open Access (2020)



3. Human Proximity Recognition


Description

The goal of this project was to develop human proximity algorithm to lock and unlock a smart bike lock.

My role was to analyze RSSI, Received Signal Strength Indication, from Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) in the Android phone and develop the proximity algorithm to detect owners' approach. The sensor data was generated from a nRF chip, noise mixed with RSSI was filtered with Kalman filter.

To see details, please refer to the paper in 'Related Articles' below.



Skills

Java
Kalman Filter
nRF SDK
Android


Period

7 months

4. 3D Virtual Mobile Interface


Description

The goal of this project was to improve a smartphone usability for the elderly with conversational 3D virtual assistant. To acheive the goal, 3D virtual companion has replaced the original interface with speech-recognition and 3D interface.

My role was to design software architecture and develop application logic layer between 3D interface and NLP engine. The application logic layer received user's speech, converted it into text, and transfer speech data to NLP engine. And next, 3D virtual companion was rendered according to anlayzed intention based on users' speech. The implemented functions included making calls, sending text messages, checking weather condition and executing some applications.



Skills

Java
C#
Android
Unity
api.ai


Period

4 months
